content: The "every 24 months" @comcastbusiness  renewal renegotiations this week... Let's see if I get to quit them this time.

A quick note about the xz-utils backdoor:
1 - luckily, no mainstream distros are affected.
2 - most run xz-utils 5.2/5.4.
3 - quick check: `xv -V`
4 - THIS IS BAD.. makes you wonder what else is happening. Thanks to people who paid attention
https://t.co/Mm8XUUifFs

2014: "TheMoon" bot infects home routers.
2024: "TheMoon" bot infects home routers.
Guess we are making a difference. NOT!! :( 

https://t.co/mTIoqtgNqT

https://t.co/1MGGccPziW

HT @BleepinComputer

Only our marketing people believe that an image of myself could attract people to take a class with me. So swapping it for my kitten, Dirac. No, she will not be in San Diego, which is for the audience's safety. But the content will be amazing regardless. https://t.co/FGBaSQ3FvR https://t.co/enr3OcO4Vu

Some late-night Facebook scammer trolling. Lesson: Urgency always works in the end, even with scammers. And you have to be VERY greedy to fall for such an obvious scam. https://t.co/fIyksxDWhm https://t.co/xrRy209zAE

If you don't understand web apps, you do not understand network security challenges. 

https://t.co/Q2xqRGmWVL

Who needs @DarthPutinKGB 's killer satellites to experience the apocalypse. Here in Jacksonville, we have @NewsfromJEA, which has had random outages to a good part of downtown the last few weeks to give us a taste of waking up without coffee.
VMware stopping distributing ESXi is a great opportunity to learn about #Proxmox https://t.co/m8dAhZCHQP @VMware
If you are reversing malware and you haven't subscribed to Anuj Soni's YouTube channel yet: You are missing out big time! @asoni #rem #dfir https://t.co/U0zB2UaM8y
https://t.co/aDlkaR6QsZ
Saying farewell to a good friend. Too bad to see Adrien go so early. https://t.co/KqwWINcKeS

Is anybody else getting spam like this from "https://t.co/nBkKgR3mJ5"? I call it spam because (a) I probably didn't mention myself on a platform I am not using (b) the only way to see what I said about myself requires $5.  I am aware of similar platforms like Researchgate. https://t.co/YRw4WO2B8G

Another abandoned dog at the dog park. Bad mange and a broken leg, but super loving and really wanted to snuggle. Luckily, animal control was able to take it in and provide care. https://t.co/nNdshmDLUb

Another step to replace myself with a script. Podcast segment created entirely by ChatGPT and Elevenlabs voice clone. They even removed my accent! :-) @thecyberwire #embracebots #scriptorbescripted https://t.co/cUSIvhBZj8
The "Details" pane in @Microsoft Defender isn't exactly full of details. @msftsecurity https://t.co/nnjOLUbCiA

Nice try @Dropbox. Getting users a 500 error if you try to close your account isn't going to keep me around. According to the support forums, this is going on for a few months now. https://t.co/uOM1a4SAkL

Completed our RSA conference learning lab submission for next year. Thnx @jasonlam_sec, for joining me to make sure I don't get into too much trouble and reminding me during the presentation how much time we have left :) https://t.co/o0EG5UE2Lj
Nice post by one of our undergraduate interns: "How I made a QWERTY Keyboard Walk Generator With ChatGPT" https://t.co/V7s4WP36z9
This is what happens when you start interacting with humans https://t.co/QWrceRveZ7

Today marks the 34th year of the Tiananmen Square massacre. I never liked the "Tank man" image. It is too clean and shows hope. The tank in that picture rolled over protesters and unarmed local military who were initially called in to contain the protests. #June4th  #Tiananmen https://t.co/7JWxYFtpf1
Teaching an online class today and Comcast is swapping the cable on the next block from me. So far so good. LTE backup tested… but let’s hope for the best https://t.co/aLklROl88y

Pretty sure this is a false positive. Is anybody else seeing this on an Intel Mac? Just started popping up today after a reboot. That is just what I was talking about at #RSAC last week... https://t.co/gGsjQrSciL

Getting close to home after #RSAC . This trip has been another reminder to minimize air travel, and to cancel my @AskAmex card. (Overcrowded lounges) Maybe in the near future, I will just hang out in the dog park for people wanting to learn about packets and web security.

Rehearsing for our panel at #RSAC later (3:55pm, Moscone East). Please attend! The echo is horrible if we don’t fill the room. @edskoudis @likethecoins @Steph3nSims @HeatherMahalik @SANSInstitute @sans_isc @SANS_EDU https://t.co/c6yWoYbwMd

Heading to #RSAC . Will be there Tuesday/Wednesday for the panel with @likethecoins @edskoudis @HeatherMahalik @Steph3nSims . I hope it is worth it given that I could go for walks with this puppy instead. https://t.co/zreCzYbBAT https://t.co/aOsfJfFwf0
Is @tmobile reducing its 5G footprint? I had the @tmobile home internet service until a few months ago, and it worked pretty well. Now it is no longer offered for my address :/

Looks like @efile reverted to an earlier version of their website this morning. The (c) is now 2022, not 2023, and lots of extra content is gone. Is incident response in progress while trying to keep the site up? #efile #efail https://t.co/2bIMBOWNbV

Xavier Mertens @xme will teach FOR610, Malware Reversing, at this event. Saying that Xavier "breaths" malware would be wrong. Instead, he inhales it and converts it into actionable threat intel with the help of some caffeine and Belgian ingenuity. 
https://t.co/4XAiXyw3Qn
Ever wondered how big ICMP errors can get? Well.. I got an answer for you in today's Packet Tuesday! https://t.co/zqCyCAgwjz #packetlife #pcaps #icmp #inpcapswetrust #packets
And yet another packet Tuesday. Sticking with IPv6 for this episode: Neighbor Discovery! https://t.co/iGMrOpRWR4 #ipv6 #packetlife #pcaps #inpcapswetrust #packettuesday

Today, I got some IPv6 Router Advertisements for you to dissect for Packet Tuesday. I hope you are having fun doing some IPv6 for a change :) https://t.co/WA3A7JLZbD #packetlife #ipv6 #sec503 #pcap #tcpdump #wireshark #packettuesday
It's time for Packet Tuesday. This week: ntp! https://t.co/szPt3HlyJH #packettuesday #ntp #packetlive #sec503
The next #PacketTuesday episode is out. I am going over ICMP errors and the recent FreeBSD ping vulnerability this time. https://t.co/2KZsddUYiJ
Verifying myself: I am jullrich on https://t.co/VTa771m0Xp. NfM73GjJ3nIDC5CeEhSFIccWksJo4cZoNdu9 / https://t.co/iCErnJPDfK
Thinking about doing “packet Wednesday” videos. Short (10 min) weekly videos dissecting a packet and talking about a particular feature. Would anybody be interested?

Episode 3 of Packet Tuesday is live. This week, it is all about the TCP Urgent flag. Trying to keep them a bit shorter in the future to not spent half an hour on one bit ;-)  (feedback again is welcome) https://t.co/HvSyNXsyZC
The latest #PacketTuesday is live. https://t.co/HvSyNXsyZC. In episode 2, learn about EDNS0. More DNS fun. Watch before Thanksgiving dinner, not after :) #sec503 @sans_edu https://t.co/LV9yuVETag

I will remove Twitter from most of my devices and keep this account open to follow some who have yet to move to other platforms. Do not expect responses from this account going forward. I will focus on @jullrich@infosec.exchange instead.
Hey, @vmware ... I really do not get the math on your checkout page. $99+$0=$240? https://t.co/yyipGxikep
Each day Twitter remains running, CEOs worldwide will ask more questions about why they are paying so much for their IT staff. https://t.co/eVD5bkcu8R
When interacting with developers at large companies: Remember to be nice to them. Many of them never code, nor do they know how to.
Remember: You don't do Microservices for performance. You do them to isolate the great code you wrote today from the crappy code you wrote yesterday.
Office companion of the day: LaiFu. Let’s see if she has enough chew toys to make it work out :). Oh, and the cats are here too… https://t.co/91HuoPCWEM
Packet Tuesday: Network Traffic Analysis for the Whole Family #packets #sec503 #network #ids #tcpdump https://t.co/Qff7z28fB7 https://t.co/chlROZdhCV

There are different types of "Industry Awards". Some are "pay to play": Buy advertisements in a journal, and they give you an award. Others are offering awards to industry celebrities to associate their organizations with said celebrities, hoping for free advertisement. #SANSDMA https://t.co/g3oPvLg9pH

Interesting Sysmon priv escalation flaw in this month's Microsoft patch Tuesday. It is always nice if the security department instruments the network for the attacker. #microsoft #patches #patchtuesday
At the dog park waiting for other dogs to chase https://t.co/JMSV4OMoWe
Reinstalling all the ports from MacPorts on my Mac kind of feels like a good old gentoo Linux install
BTX -> BBS (Maus net) -> Bitnet -> Usenet -> irc -> web forums -> MySpace -> Facebook -> Twitter -> @jullrich@mastodon.social (maybe.. not 100% sure about that platform yet) https://t.co/rA9zyqLWZO

Is anybody else surprised that JavaScript used to allow you to opt-out of cookies is more privacy-invasive than the cookies it allows you to adjust? #stupideuropeans #privacyisanillusion #giveupandclickok #cookietheater
National Cyber League team games this weekend. Go Sentinels! (about time for @ESPN to carry it). #NationalCyberLeague @SANS_EDU #sentinels #ncl https://t.co/SBOnruMqMM
Hm. Someone asked if I "trade" SANS courseware with them and sent the offer to my SANS email address? Great move, kid! https://t.co/R3Q2I3knEy
Happy students spreading the word about @sans_edu . Proud to be part of this team. https://t.co/OrXpxAbNbw

SANS has revamped the "Difference Maker" award this year. If you look at the list of nominees, you may not recognize many names. This is by design, and it is a great change. The goal of an award is not just to reward people who "made a difference", 1/6 🧵 #SANSDMA https://t.co/uH8OITGPTw
If you upgraded your Mac to Ventura, and use Office 365: Don't forget to remove your MSFT account and add it again. Otherwise you miss a lot of calendar events as they no longer sync :(

The "Packet Wednesday" idea I mentioned a while ago is becoming real as "Packet Tuesday". Will start Nov 15th with short videos every week going in depth on network packets. Think dissecting headers and such. 1/2🧵

To anybody "mad" at OpenSSL only releasing a "High" vulnerability today: You got a great opportunity to exercise your response skills. Are you mad if you don't get into an accident while wearing a seatbelt?
Dog and candy is ready. Now we better get some kids coming by for the candy. https://t.co/cRsjqLGP19
@web808 @sans_isc Dogs are so much better than cats.
Intrusion detection (and #DFIR?) version of the DNS Haiku #sec503 #networks #ids https://t.co/1TI7VwZA6C

Dog #4 for the year abandoned at the dog park. To make things worse: This one escaped before I could catch it, so now it is roaming in panic around the streets. If you must discard your pet, do so at animal control or the humane society.
hm. No exchange patch today I guess. Unless it will come out a bit later. https://t.co/NkE29KJJMH
I know I may be alone with this opinion. But attaching a binary to an image is not steganography. It is just a lazy trick to bypass lazy malware signatures.
Florida Tardis sighting in the storm! #hurricaneian #jacksonville #florida #tardis #drwho https://t.co/bygs822U5H
Hey @McAfee . Looks like some of your affiliates are using #scareware tactics to help sell your product. see https[:]//program-unity[.]com/ redirecting to your site https://t.co/cUMcitXszc
At the risk of losing my last few followers: I do not like lord of the rings. Neither books, original movies or the Amazon series. :(
I wish MacOS updates would not overwrite my customized PAM configuration :(

After my old standing desk motor died (no real support/spare parts from @biomorphdesks :( after 15 years), I spent the long labor day weekend redoing my setup using a new desk (a cheaper one this time). #battlestations https://t.co/sRSKiq5x6Y

Reason #1938 why people suck: this is the third time this year that someone dumped a dog at the local dog park. It isn’t hard to drop it off at one of the two no kill shelters in the city. Now I get to deal with that tomorrow. https://t.co/1CXJ55MdrZ

A simple "DHL Package" malspam, and security vendors can't do any better than that? My 3-month-old puppy knows that this is was from a "bad dog." She almost peed on my keyboard when she saw it. https://t.co/DF5kD1ujvL

The puppy practiced intrusion prevention and blocked an attack by quickly air gapping the system. Now I have to figure out what attack (she doesn't always get the CVE numbers right). I think she mentioned something about "cats".. 5 or 6 that she noticed attacking https://t.co/wyTiJv9rLU
After studying, LaiFu had a great time at the dog park yesterday, learning how to play "stick." And some well-deserved rest on the couch later. https://t.co/hVmyl3nead

New puppy getting ready to become the next official packet sniffer by catching up on some machine learning. She has big paw prints to fill #sec595 ⁦@SANSInstitute⁩ ⁦@SANS_EDU⁩ #sentinelintraining https://t.co/k7nzhW0MIC

Fun fact: "packing" a binary makes it more likely to be detected as malware. I created a oneliner "Hello World" python script and compiled it to a Windows binary. As soon as upx packed it, Windows flagged it as malicious. .. some even flag UPX itself as malicious. #falsepositive

People are often frustrated searching for jobs. Remember: It is in part a keyword game to get past gatekeepers. I just looked at this infosec job on LinkedIn. #infosecjobs #keywords #noskillz https://t.co/ueCl2N4QOI

The picture of the Conti ransomware person reminds me a bit of a porch pirate in the neighborhood who wore a Pikachu Pokemon hat. Needless to say, it didn't work out well. Let's hope the distinctive headdress doesn't work out too well for the Conti gang either. https://t.co/8e6RnTS5SH

Working on new student exercises... few days of kicking around ideas and trying things out... half a day of discarding it all that and starting over. then another half day to actually create the exercise.

So looks like another wave of these extortion emails is currently making the rounds. Why are people still falling for them? You would think that all the people gullible enough to believe them have run out of money to pay by now? https://t.co/AhKQ8dZjph
@PhilHagen @chriselgee that sounds like a star trek time-loop episode :)

Coffee and DDoS in the morning... how is your day going? In addition to the innocent but not skilled researcher (NAPT), we got traffic from a bunch of Chinese /24s nicely spread out. Oh well.. iptables to the rescue and moving on.

To the anonymous researcher in HK trying to scan IPv6 address space using our API... what did you drink/smoke to make you think this is a good idea? We don't even support IPv6 on that API function yet. #IPv6 https://t.co/WVJoU1rtJE
not even attackers are using #IPv6. So why should you? https://t.co/1jNR5ZRWkg
Suggested Read: Exfiltrating Data via Browser Bookmark Sync. ("Bookmark Bruggling"). @sans_edu https://t.co/l9QU3ABlKZ #browser #dataexfil #chrome #safari #firefox https://t.co/nLqAKD7G09
so because TCP was too slow, we now use UDP for HTTP/3 in order to properly to DNS over HTTP? Can we now please just run QUIC over HTTP/1.1 and close the circle for symmetry, please?
Another day, another @Delta delay. Let’s see if 3 hrs layover is enough to make my connection this time. So far 1 1/2 hrs delayed due to ramp worker issues and a faulty engine sensor.

I think I found were @Delta is testing its “#ATL-2030” concept to respond to pilot shortage and increasing number of cancelations #skymiles #skymileslife #pilotshortage #July4th #gliderplanes https://t.co/pa1KsytnOH
Who you trust? Certainly not your ISP / telco. Spyware vendor targets users in Italy and Kazakhstan https://t.co/93xDeSW3Ba

Waking up to a message from @Delta that my flight today is canceled. Trying to find a replacement flight before coffee and not succeeding. 40+ minutes wait to speak to someone.  Never understand how people travel that don't absolutely have to. #skymileslife

Interesting. Never heard of this bank before. So I figured it was an interesting Phishing attempt. But the link in it appears legit. Maybe just some mass mail thing going crazy? Is anybody else getting this email or knows the bank? https://t.co/5G8I4LM5cm

Is anybody else seeing SYN scans with two-byte #TCP Fast Open? Shouldn't this be at least 8 bytes for the cookie (and my server doesn't support #TFO, so I should only see the cookie request coming in) https://t.co/Fny6yMT3Gs
Recording of the Lifetime Achievement award for Alan Paller yesterday: https://t.co/1d0eaA6FZD
Join me in 30 minutes (1pm PT) for alive stream here from our booth at #RSAC anything ISC or whatever comes to mind :) https://t.co/yG4gVyvKOz @SANSInstitute @sans_isc @SANS_EDU
June 3rd, 1989, Tiananmen Square, Beijing. #TiananmenSquareMassacre #freedom #tiananmen #毋忘六四 #june4  🇭🇰 (Photo: AP) https://t.co/enMAJo6GMg

Brilliant work by @RobertMLee et al.
SANS ICS HyperEncabulator https://t.co/yBmqwCMruf via @YouTube
I used @Sophos home on my Mac at home for a week. Uninstalled yesterday and all the misc connectivity issues I had with it running went away. Why can't they get AV right?
You must be doing something right if #China is considering developing special weapons to shut you down. https://t.co/XbYogzhW0T #starlink @spacex
Compromising Python/PHP packages and exfiltrating random victims' AWS credentials as part of a "research experiment" is not "good-faith security research".
Finally got a good picture of one of our backyard critters. #floridalife https://t.co/LceUitHnyC
Finally, Twitter's algorithm got it right. https://t.co/fXQfXR1A1w
Enjoying the cool weather while it lasts, working on the porch today. But my supervisor is asleep. 🐈‍⬛ https://t.co/yMJiTKf8uf
The joy of anonymous YouTube comments. But I kind of wonder how he knew about where and how I recorded this. https://t.co/Vgps3hSG02
See the last paragraph @DidierStevens quoted last time @F5 BIG-IP was vulnerable: https://t.co/JvooOkNO2a #bigip #itoldyouso

Next time you have that great idea to solve cyber security: Run it past a person whose only computing device is an off-brand Android phone with a shattered screen. Don't know such a person? Your idea probably sucks.
Really?? @USTreasury ?? How old is this site and why did I just use a password manager to create an extra long random password?? https://t.co/miGQFcTj4K

Traveling. And with Easter, grocery stores are closed so I went to a Dollar store and found this honest label. Usually I like to get some Apple juice as it helps my voice when teaching all week. But I skipped this “flavored sugar juice” https://t.co/bZm5FNDfd1
And yes... managed to reset the password on the Netoptics Director. Just a matter of them renaming U-Boot env variables a bit. Oh.. and the prior password are stored in the clear.
anybody here knows the secret handshake to reset the password on a very old #Netoptics Director? #packets #toys #networktaps @netoptics @ixiacom
Am I the only one right now having a ticket open with their ISP to open up port 445/tcp? (they said they aren't blocking it... but well, they are :( ).

Weird text messages from my dentist. Are there people that go "Oh. it is Crown Week, and $100 off... let me get a crown tomorrow!". Same with emergency rooms advertising wait times on highway billboards. "Hm. Only 5 minutes... let me get a heart attack and drive over" https://t.co/nrGhMGYzgI
@Sweordbora @DrScriptt @b0rk isn't that what DNAME records are for?

Want to experience the "social media bubble" first hand? Try searching for the Ukrainian vs the Russian spelling of city names in Ukraine. Some overlap as people try to reach the other side, but many are just talking to themselves inside their bubble.
Why does renewing a @Comcast contract feel like negotiating a ransomware payment? The salespeople should just own their bad reputation and take payments in Monero.

Today, https://t.co/g5qoMst0iL announced that to express their support for the government, Russian govt employees should change all their passwords to "Put1n4ever". Tiktok users may also use "Kadyrov95" instead. RT to spread the word. #cyber #passwords #tiktok

Could people please stop breaking applications by moving them into the cloud believing load balancers and app gateways will save them? The amount of 50x errors I get these days from these apps is insane.
@beckerdite yeah. I am not sure how someone expects to speed up an application by turning one HTTP request into 10.
is @isbgpsafeyet giving false results right now? It says I am connecting from an Akamai AS (I am on Comcast AS 7922). odd. Maybe an #IPv6 issue?
Anybody else thinks it is kind of ironic that in order to file a support request with @irobot, you have to prove that you are not a robot?
False-positive of the day: Getting locked out of file sharing by @Dropbox after sharing some #snort rules #falsepositives https://t.co/Vm42DjErwK

Why I need to follow more puppy/kitten pic accounts and stop trying to fix infosec: (1) yet again high school kids are "advanced adversaries" (2) getting locked out of my own website by the security solution my company is using. @zscaler #wesuckatinfosec #wearedoomed https://t.co/vkKjDfGGXg
more scams. this time good old Twitter: https://t.co/xqc66C8MET
Apple just released macOS 12.3. While you probably want to upgrade (new Emojis!!!), note that it removes Python 2 and some Dropbox/OneDrive kernel extensions. But NEW EMOJIS! #macos #apple
When you are trying to test your tech before class in one of those broom closets they call “rooms” here in #London :) https://t.co/NhIY222Tqr

As you are watching the news about the war in #Ukraine: Remember that any bit of news your receive travels over networks maintained by people in the war zone. Some have already been injured and killed as their facilities (like the TV tower and power stations) are being targeted.

The fact that there are still camera live streams from #Kyiv made me think of this cartoon. Some amazing people somewhere keeping all the infrastructure working. (And with that defenses more important than livestreams) #sysadmin #uptime #itheroes https://t.co/szGfg6mE8l

If you do one thing today: Double check that your router is up to date, uses a secure password and does not expose the admin interface to the world (ok. that is three things. but take the 10 minutes to do it today)
Headlines stating "Iranian Hackers exploit vuln x" mean: YOU ARE WAY TOO LATE PATCHING! Iranian's tend to pick up the crumbs left by everybody else. https://t.co/RH192qgtow
Can I have this for puppies too? https://t.co/adB20vRmLg
One of the many reasons why I still think Perl is the best programing language ever: https://t.co/9dBNpLghtd
13th anniversary (3,169 episodes) of the SANS Internet Storm Center daily podcast. Latest episode: https://t.co/9NogrgTq1Y First episode: https://t.co/lCx7ejSChk
To everybody up north posting snow pictures. A Florida snow picture. I guess "snow cones picture" is close enough. This just drove past my house. https://t.co/bK1I4ZyyRF
don't get distracted from Infosec twitter by vulnerabilities like this: https://t.co/xhBngjYfbA

This keeps happening to us. Cats just showing up and claiming the place like it is theirs. This cat started to show up a couple weeks ago asking for food. Now I found him in my office. https://t.co/c2TvWAr9fq
@jimwagmn haha. yes. I should let him run a podcast :)
Sorry, @fractureme. But I am not able to register on your website. I am not able to generate a password that short (and one that will probably be stored in the clear?) https://t.co/Z3lg6wbQbt

Now this deserves some kind of "Hack of the Year" award if real. Super creative, no damage done as far as I can tell, and well... just very much "out of the box" https://t.co/d0lrLTEpG3 (any why was this connected to the internet again???)

This morning, we lost our dog Facai Chew (Fācái 发财) to lymphoma. I first met her about 15 years ago. At the time, we fostered a dog, and while walking him, this puppy with a big chain around her neck started to follow us, so I took her home. We tried to find an owner. 1/10 https://t.co/nRToIMh0W8
Interesting product on Amazon. But then again, I am sure my cat would push that down first before sitting on the keyboard. https://t.co/4Mk9wr20fD
If you are Googleing an Exchange Server error message and get this warning from Google: :) https://t.co/aticaD2v2c
2,700 donors only? The software is used by Billions. Let's change that. https://t.co/OZIxEG5Jed https://t.co/6Rudm2ZBD9
It is 2022... and the Firmware update released June 2021 by @CyberpowerInfo still does not allow HTTPS??? #tlseverywhere #cybersecurityfail #encryptordie https://t.co/fS6tq90Xye

So looks like @Generac just sent all of its "MobileLink" customers a message to check the App.. which in turn overwhelmed the site. (and enough people called them to also overwhelm their phone support).
I kind of like nftables. Some nice new options. But naming the command-line tool "nft" makes googling for help unnecessarily difficult. All I get are crypto scams.
It is Wednesday... so what does that mean? AWS issues of course. https://t.co/39Ucvl0IPI. Nothing huge. At least with ISC/DShield not being in the cloud so far.
Does Amazon know something I don't know? Let's hope we do not need this thing here in FL this winter :) https://t.co/1xJDvRGrpv

Brute force #log4j2 / #log4shell patch?
find / -name 'jvm.options'
append "-Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true" at the end, reboot ?
@hugoslabbert @cynicalsecurity The atomic clock chips are still a bit pricey (looks like around $1000, but they are hard to find)

Our @SANSInstitute keynote is confirmed for #RSAC2022 . It will be very different for me this year. But lets hope it will be in person again. @edskoudis @likethecoins @heathermahalik  https://t.co/DQzF7rK2Ov
I guess I exceeded the maximum pull force for this fiber :( #overstuffedconduit https://t.co/35gG6oOrJr
@magg_py absolutely. Which is why the dog park here has an armed guard.
Not sure what everybody is talking about regarding football today. All the UEFA champions league games happened Tuesday/Wednesday this week :(

I am going to join @jasonlam_sec for a live stream tomorrow (1pm ET) . We will look "behind the curtain" of distributed ("cloudy") web apps and some of the security issues around them. See https://t.co/PePtay1uNc to set a reminder.
@PhilHagen as long as we use only ARM VMs for labs, this is a non issue. So just drop x86 support.

Trying to connect to a Linux system via a serial terminal. But hoping to avoid the adapter hell... is there a way to do this via USB-C on both ends without a USB-C->Serial to Serial->USB-C connection? *Should* work ... but how? (or USB-A...)
Facebook is building the Metaverse to give us a place to escape to after they made reality unlivable? Kind of like car companies buying/shutting down trains to get people to buy cars?
First work trip since RSA 2020 (and well, the reason there is no Thursday podcast. ) https://t.co/mkr2p9ar4U
Who else has people walk parrots past their house? #parrots #petwalking https://t.co/UVVmoZ0S8H
Have we already forgotton how much "fun" CodeRed and Nimda were? I guess not too many Twitter users from back then. https://t.co/dZj46xbWIg #codered #nimda #apache #CVE202141773

Totally guessing here. But the longer the #facebookoutage lasts, the more I believe this is an insider attack in response to the #60minutes story yesterday. Someone knew what keys to press for maximum impact?

yes, I deleted my Facebook account last week.
no. This isn't my doing. But enjoy it while it lasts. #facebookdown https://t.co/XOv29Xupda

Facebook outage made me think: How many of you still have out-of-band access to routers via #dialup #modems? I remember that was common back in the day even after Broadband was common. Thinking about WFH router admin "issues".

@bbtrev no I have not. but remember that I am using a honeypot to detect this and it just emulates some of the features. An attacker launching a more manual attack would easily detect that this is a honeypot. The reverse shell also doesn't work on the honeypot.

@seidenschwang Don't have any data on the IE 0Day Exploit :( But wouldn't be surprised if it goes back to December. For these targeted attacks, it takes a while for new exploits to get discovered and reported.

quick snort rule for #cve201919781:  content: "NSC_USER:"; fast_pattern; content: "NSC_USER:"; http_header; content: "/../"; http_header; content: "POST"; http_method; content: "NSC_NONCE:" ; http_header; content: ".pl"; http_uri; content: "/vpns/"; http_uri;
